channel.title: Question about hosting
channel.description: Hello I am the owner of ttgpkscape and theres tons of people in my server and theres just to much lagg for my computer so I need to figure out a new way to host my server I heard about hosting it off of a webpage and stuff like that and I need advise on what I'm doing. Thanks

item.title: Question about hosting
item.dc:creator: @archerkill30 archerkill30
item.description:
@archerkill30 wrote:

Yes I am in it more for the profit then the fun but I just don’t see anyone donating any money because most of the people who play in the servers are 10 years old. Its a risky move and I don’t want to waste 50$.

Read full topic

item.title: Question about hosting
item.dc:creator: @Rudolph Rudolph
item.description:
@Rudolph wrote:

[quote=“archerkill30, post:5, topic:151525”]why would anyone spend 50$ a month for a runescape private server?[/quote]Well, if you were smart enough you would know why. But, I’ll tell you anyways. It’s good for making profit if you’re going for that, but it’s also good for the experience and fun…Ex: I’m going to use a dedi for my V5 which will cause hardly any lag at all, along with getting to experience it, getting donations, and all of it is pretty much like a cycle…you spend the money to get it going, and if your server is good enough & popular enough, then people might actually donate.

Read full topic

why would anyone spend 50$ a month for a runescape private server?

Get a dedicated server.

item.title: Question about hosting
item.dc:creator: @archerkill30 archerkill30
item.description:
@archerkill30 wrote:

I’m not even playing its hosted on my brothers computer, and hes not playing eather and he has 2gb of ram also.

What do I do after I upload my server to a ftp server? is there a way I can host it off my private ftp server?[br][size=1]Posted on: October 13, 2007, 01:38:48 PM[/size][hr]so is it or is it not possible to host my server off of a ftp server? if not is there a diff way.

Read full topic
